ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Excellent French skills in a close knit environment, as well as general language acquisition tools
I learned a ton of french grammar. In fact I think I leanrned more than I had expected.

I can probably have a decent conversation with someone after taking L1 french. Its much easier to understand written french rather than when its spoken. Also, it is sometimes hard to produce oral responses quickly. Overall, learned a good base knowledge of french.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The in class work was the most helpful for me. I wish we had spoken more or done some in person oral production.

The course is very rigorous, and if you start to fall behind, it gets harder and harder to catch up. I wish more attention was put on teaching the verb forms and how to use them rather than vocabulary. Some of the vocab learned seemed a little not applicable to every day life. However, because the class was rather hard and forced you to practice every day, you feel as if you are actually learning a lot and can see the results.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Hard but enjoyable. I definitely recommend it.
Any student who wishes to learn french should take this course.

This course is a lot of work, so be prepared. However, it is extremely rewarding and you actually feel as if you are learning french pretty quickly. The class meets every day, there's a quiz (written and oral production) every week, there's a written composition every week, and there's textbook exercises checked every week, which is a lot to keep up with. It is doable if you stay on top of things, but if you start to fall behind on the work...yikes. It is actually a really good class though.
